Detailed Description

The PlmnHandler holds the functionality for receiving asynchronous plmn- and network-specific signals coming up from the protocolstack (like registration changes, etc) and provides an interface for the application to setup various plmn- and network-specific requests.

Member Function Documentation

void PlmnHandler::ChangeGprsClass (  const GprsClass &  gprs_class  )  const
 

The method ChangeGprsClass() is used to change the current GPRS mobile class. This function is detaching the ME from network, sets the gprs-class and is re-attaching the ME to the network The current active class can be read out from the StatusProvider.

BOOLEAN PlmnHandler::ChangePreferedRatMode (  RadioAccessTechnology  rat_mode  )  const
 

Change the prefered RAT(Radio Acces Technology). This function is detaching the ME from network, sets the prefered RAT and is re-attaching the ME to the network if it was attached before. Using this function makes no sense if the RatChangeMode is not set to RatChangeModeDual because only in this case this has any effect.

Parameters:
rat_mode RatGsm or RatUmts
Returns:
TRUE if possible

BOOLEAN PlmnHandler::ChangePrefService (  GsmService  gsm_service  )  const
 

Set the prefered service to CircuitSwitched or PacketSwitched, other values are not allowed!! This imply a detach and a attack because the setting can only take effect before attaching.

Parameters:
gsm_service CircuitSwitched or PacketSwitched is allowed

BOOLEAN PlmnHandler::ChangeRatMode (  RatChangeMode  rat_change_mode,
RadioAccessTechnology  rat_mode = RatNotAvailable
)  const
 

Change the RAT-mode of the MS. This function is detaching the ME from network, sets the rat-mode and is re-attaching the ME to the network if it was attached before.

Parameters:
rat_change_mode - Change of rat-mode makes only sense if protocol-stack is supporting this feature(UMTS dual mode) otherwise this setting will have no effect.
rat_mode - Change of prefered rat mode. This makes only sense if the stack is supporting this feature(UMTS dual mode) and the rat_change_mode is set to RatChangeModeDual otherwise this setting has no effect
Returns:
TRUE if possible

void PlmnHandler::Detach (   )  const
 

The method Detach() is used to detach and disable the GSM service. the registration of a specific plmn.

Get the actual prefered RadioAccessTechnology

Returns:
RatNotAvailable if not available

GsmService PlmnHandler::GetPrefService (   )  const
 

Get the currently set GsmService

void PlmnHandler::InterruptScan (   )  const
 

The method InterruptScan() interrupts an active scanning for plmns.

BOOLEAN PlmnHandler::IsRatChangePossible (   )  const
 

Check if the change of RAT-mode(Radio Access Technology) is possible

Returns:
TRUE if possible

BOOLEAN PlmnHandler::IsRegistrationAllowed (   )  const
 

returns TRUE, if registration can be performed (allowed by protocolstack)

BOOLEAN PlmnHandler::IsScanInProgress (   )  const
 

Check if there is already a Scan in progress.

void PlmnHandler::Register (  const RegisterMode &  mode,
const Plmn &  plmn = InvalidPlmn,
RadioAccessTechnology  plmn_rat_mode = RatNotAvailable
)  const
 

The method Register(const RegisterMode &mode, const Plmn &plmn, RatChangeMode rat_change_mode = InvalidRatChangeMode) is used to attach the GSM service of a specific plmn. The method can be called with two different modes, the automatic or the manual mode. The response for the registration is sent via an asynchronous registration message.

Parameters:
mode Automatic or the Manual mode.
plmn plmn to register - only needed by manual registration.
rat_mode - RadioAccessTechnology for register-plmn. Only available in case of manual registration.

BOOLEAN PlmnHandler::Scan (   ) 
 

The method Scan() starts the scanning for all available plmns in a non-blocking way. The answer (list of available PLMNs is returned by the message PlmnScanFinishedMsg.

Returns:
FALSE if other scan is running

BOOLEAN PlmnHandler::Scan (  PlmnScanList &  plmn_scan_list  ) 
 

The method Scan(PlmnScanList &) does the scanning for all available plmns in a blocking mode. The function returns, when the network-request has finished.

Parameters:
plmn_scan_list a list of all the currently available plmns.
Returns:
FALSE if other scan is running
